fields.name: searchTransactionsForward
fields.description:
Search the blockchain forward for transaction *execution traces* based on `query`.

When the returned `cursor` is empty, it means you have reached the end of the specified block
range.

WARN: always consider the `undo` field in forward searches, which signal that the matching element
was in fact REMOVED from the chain because of blocks reorganization.

See also the streaming version under `Subscription`

fields.name: searchTransactionsBackward
fields.description:
Search the blockchain backward for transaction *execution traces* based on `query`.

When the returned `cursor` is empty, it means you have reached the end of the specified block
range.

See also the streaming version under `Subscription`

fields.name: blockIDByTime
fields.description: Return the block ID found around the given `time`, based on the `comparator` provided.

fields.name: blockIDAtAccountCreation
fields.description: Return the block Number where given `account` was created.

fields.name: searchTransactionsForward
fields.description:
Search the blockchain forward for transaction *execution traces* based on `query`.

WARN: always consider the `undo` field in forward searches, which signal that the matching element
was in fact REMOVED from the chain because of blocks reorganization.

fields.name: searchTransactionsBackward
fields.description:
Search the blockchain backward for transaction execution traces based on `query`.

NOTE: The `undo` field is not used in backwards search.

fields.name: cursor
fields.description: This is a chain-wide cursor, indicating the progress of a search. You can pass it back to the different search methods to continue fetching more results, in *either directions* (even in the reverse direction). A `null` cursor means the end of range has been reached.

name: SearchTransactionForwardResponse
description:
A single transaction trace response, matching a forward search query.

WARNING: do NOT forget to include the `undo` field to determine if the message is actually a REVERSAL of the transaction.

NOTE: always check the value of `trace.status` to make sure it is `executed` if you want to make sure a transaction made it to the chain.

fields.name: undo
fields.description:
Whether this response is an UNDO operation of a previously sent response.

In a forward search, make sure you catch this and always verify its value.. as to not double or triple count transactions.

fields.name: cursor
fields.description: Chain-wide cursor, allowing you to continue querying when connection is interrupted

fields.name: isIrreversible
fields.description: Whether the block represented here is irreversible

fields.name: irreversibleBlockNum
fields.description: The last known irreversible block when processing this transaction.  This number can be equal to the current block num (under `trace.block.num`), in which case, `isIrreversible` is true.  In the reversible segment of the chain, this number will be drifting away by the number of blocks separating head block and LIB.

fields.name: trace
fields.description:
Traces of execution of the transaction containing matching actions.

Check `matchingActions` below to limit the response to only actions matching your search query. Although, all actions from the transactions are available (see `executedActions`).

name: SearchTransactionBackwardResponse
description:
A single transaction trace response, matching a backward search query.

NOTE: always check the value of `trace.status` to make sure it is `executed` if you want to make sure a transaction made it to the chain.

fields.name: cursor
fields.description: Chain-wide cursor, allowing you to continue querying when connection is interrupted

fields.name: isIrreversible
fields.description: Whether the block represented here is irreversible

fields.name: irreversibleBlockNum
fields.description: The last known irreversible block when processing this transaction.  This number can be equal to the current block num (under `trace.block.num`), in which case, `isIrreversible` is true.  In the reversible segment of the chain, this number will be drifting away by the number of blocks separating head block and LIB.

fields.name: trace
fields.description:
Traces of execution of the transaction containing matching actions.

Check `matchingActions` below to limit the response to only actions matching your search query. Although, all actions from the transactions are available (see `executedActions`).

name: TransactionTrace
description:
Traces of the execution of a given transaction. This means the
transaction was executed on the chain. You also get context about the
block in which it was executed, and the status of the execution.

WARN: Make sure to always check the `status` (in the `receipt`) to
make sure you're not considering a failed transaction as if it was
successful.

fields.name: block
fields.description: Block in which this transaction trace occurred

fields.name: status
fields.description: This is a short-hand for `receipt.status`.

fields.name: netUsage
fields.description: Amount of network bandwidth consumed (for the sake of the rate limiting engine) by this whole transaction, in bytes (short-hand for `receipt.net_usage_words * 8`.

fields.name: scheduled
fields.description: Whether this transaction was originally a scheduled transaction.

fields.name: executedActions
fields.description: Lists all action traces, flattened and ordered by execution time.

fields.name: matchingActions
fields.description: Returns a flattened list of action traces, in _execution_ order, of only the matching transactions (from a search, or other filtering).

fields.name: topLevelActions
fields.description: Traces of actions at depth=0, those part of the original Transaction. In `nodeos` version 1.7.0 and below, this corresponds to the `action_traces` field.

name: BlockHeader
description: BlockHeader is the header of a block, excluding the transactions in that block.

fields.name: id
fields.description: ID of the block

fields.name: num
fields.description: Block number in the chain

name: ActionTrace
description: ActionTrace holds the traces of execution of a single action within a transaction.

fields.name: seq
fields.description: Global sequence ID for this action in this chain (shorthand for receipt.global_sequence). NOTE: if this is a failed action, seq will be 0.

fields.name: executionIndex
fields.description: Zero-based index of this action within the transaction, in _execution_ order.

fields.name: receipt
fields.description:
Action receipt (which differs from the Transaction receipt).

The receipt will be null when failures occur. Verify the `status`
field on the TransactionTrace object.

fields.name: receiver
fields.description:
Account which code was executed to produce this execution trace.

Shorthand for receipt.receiver

fields.name: account
fields.description:
Target method's account name.  This does *not* correspond to the contract code being executed, that is what `receiver` means.  This value namespaces your actions.

Shorthand for act.account in `nodeos` traces

fields.name: name
fields.description:
Target method's action name. This value, combined with the `account`, determines which code path will be executed in the `receiver` contract code.

Shorthand for act.name in `nodeos` traces.

fields.name: authorization
fields.description:
Signatories required to execute this action.

Shorthand for `act.authorization` in `nodeos` traces.

fields.name: data
fields.description:
Data payload. Might be a string or a JSON object, depending on whether it was possible to unpack it using an ABI.

Shorthand for `act.data` in `nodeos` traces.

fields.name: json
fields.description:
JSON Object representing the action parameters, decoded through the ABI. Will be `null` if it wasn't possible to decode it.

Shorthand for action.json

fields.name: hexData
fields.description:
Hex-encoded string representing the raw data for the action.

Shorthand for `act.hex_data` in `nodeos` traces.

fields.name: ramOps
fields.description:
A list of RAM mutation operations, produced by this transaction.

NOTE: the RAM ops on an action never include operations that are mutations of the transaction itself (like creation of a deferred, or removal of a deferred from RAM). For this, check `ramOps` on the TransactionTrace object.

fields.name: dtrxOps
fields.description: A list of all operations affecting deferred transactions, like creation, deletion, modification, produced by this action.

fields.name: tableOps
fields.description: A list of table mutation operations (creation or deletion of a _table_, not a _row_).

fields.name: dbOps
fields.description: A list of database operations produced by this action. Insertions, modifications and deletions of any table _rows_ in the scope of this action's `receiver`.

fields.name: console
fields.description: Output of the action's `print()` statements from within the smart contract.

fields.name: contextFree
fields.description: Whether this action is a context-free action.

fields.name: elapsed
fields.description: Elapsed time between the beginning of the execution of this action, relative to the time the whole transaction started to be processed

fields.name: exceptJSON
fields.description: If non-null, this action failed. The stack and reasons will be found within the raw JSON payload provided.

fields.name: isNotify
fields.description: Whether this action is a notification, meaning that it was triggered as a side effect rom another contract, and copied the exact same payload from the original transaction.  This happens when you call the `require_notify` method from the EOSIO intrinsics (from within a smart-contract).

fields.name: isMatchingQuery
fields.description: Whether or not this action matched the dfuse search query

fields.name: createdActions
fields.description: Traces of actions _created_ by this action. WARN: this doesn't infer that the operations were written to the blockchain in this order, only that it was created by this action. To obtain execution order, see `executedActions` on the TransactionTrace object.

fields.name: creatorAction
fields.description: Trace of the action that created this one, the one which _created_ this action. WARN: it is not necessarily the parent in execution order, but will reflect which smart contract did the creation of either the notification, action or context_free_action.

fields.name: closestUnnotifiedAncestorAction
fields.description:
Use this to rebuild the execution tree, using the `nodeos` dispatch algorithm of notifications, actions and context-free actions.

This is similar to what you would have gotten in `nodeos` prior to version 1.8.0.

name: RAMOp
description: Represents a change in consumption of RAM for a given account

fields.name: operation
fields.description: What happened to justify this change in RAM.

fields.name: payer
fields.description: The account being debited or credited RAM

fields.name: delta
fields.description: Number of bytes that were either consumed (positive) or released (negative)

fields.name: usage
fields.description:
Number of bytes now used by the `payer` account, after applying this RAM operation.

To have a precise view of the RAM left on an account after this transaction was applied, go through all actions in execution order (`TransactionTrace.executedActions`) and use the last RAMOp for the given account.

name: DTrxOp
description: A change in deferred transactions in the chain's memory.

fields.name: operation
fields.description: The source or cause of creation/modification/deletion of a deferred transaction

fields.name: payer
fields.description: The account being debited or credited to store this deferred transaction

fields.name: publishedAt
fields.description: The time this deferred was published at

fields.name: delayUntil
fields.description: The time at which Block Producers will start attempting to execute this transaction

fields.name: expirationAt
fields.description: The time at which Block Producers will evict this transaction from memory if it fails execution.

fields.name: trxID
fields.description: The transaction ID of the `transaction`

fields.name: transaction
fields.description: The deferred transaction payload itself.

name: TableOp
description: Creation or deletion of a table

name: DBOp
description: Represents the mutation of a row, in a contract table.

fields.name: oldPayer
fields.description: Previous paying account.  This is null in the case of an insertion.

fields.name: newPayer
fields.description: New paying account.  This is null in the case of a deletion.

fields.name: key
fields.description: Primary key of the row in the table.

fields.name: oldData
fields.description: Contents (hex data) of the row before a REM or UPD operation.

fields.name: newData
fields.description: Contents (hex data) of the row after an INS or UPD operation.

fields.name: oldJSON
fields.description: Decoded version of oldData

fields.name: newJSON
fields.description: Decoded version of newData

name: ActionReceipt
description:
Execution receipt for a given ActionTrace.

The `nodeos` field `auth_sequence` is not yet present. Contact us if you need it.

fields.name: receiver
fields.description: Account for which code is being triggered. Beware that this might not be the same value as `account`, or the target account of the action, in the case of notifications. See documentation for `require_notify` in EOSIO contracts

fields.name: digest
fields.description: Hash of the action payload. Also known as `act_digest` from `nodeos`

fields.name: globalSequence
fields.description:
Globally unique sequence number in all actions from the longest chain. This will never be reused, and is guaranteed to monotonically increment with each action.

This property can be relied on to keep track of forks in your database, at the action level.

WARNING: when micro-forks happens, global sequences from the different forks will be reused, but will be associated with other actions. This is why it's important to navigate forks properly.

fields.name: refBlockNum
fields.description:
TaPoS reference block num.

This value holds only 16 bits of the blockNum (instead of 32).
The other 16 bits are in the current blockNum (unless overflown).

fields.name: refBlockPrefix
fields.description: TaPoS block prefix (bytes 8-16 of the block ID), in order to identify the correct fork for a given block number.

fields.name: time
fields.description: "true" if a block id was found
